etymology.description: Proto-form 悤 (pictogram: 心 with a hole) -> Phonetic 囪 + Semantic 心 = open heart/open mind -> Later: Phonetic 悤 + Semantic 耳 = intelligence through listening
etymology.interpretation: The character 聰(cōng, 'clever') originally depicted an open heart and mind, symbolizing intelligence. It evolved to focus on listening, with 耳 (ear) representing the ability to learn quickly by hearing.

examples.chinese: 他聰明過人(他聰明過人)。
老師讚許他的聰明(老師讚許他的聰明)，鼓勵其他同學努力學習(鼓勵其他同學努力學習)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī zànxǔ tā de cōngmíng, gǔlì qítā tóngxué nǔlì xuéxí.
examples.english: The teacher praised his cleverness and encouraged his classmates to study hard.

examples.chinese: 這個孩子既活潑又聰明(這個孩子既活潑又聰明)，深受大家喜愛(深受大家喜愛)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège háizi jì huópō yòu cōngmíng, shēn shòu dàjiā xǐ'ài.
examples.english: This child is both lively and clever, and is deeply loved by everyone.
